item.title: Cache problems :P need help reward is admin on my server
item.dc:creator: @jamie233 jamie233
item.description:
@jamie233 wrote:

[quote=“lord0ftacos, post:12, topic:506533”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=624765.msg4254946#msg4254946 date=1362579891]

You’re cache needs to be in a place that supports instant downloads, meaning no click to download crap.

Mediafire does support direct downloads if you’re a premium member…

@OP search through the client for armadyll.info and give us the code around where you find it
[/quote]

I just searched it and it said 0 results…but yah…[/quote]
Search arma … armadyll … armydll.info… It’s not going to pop up and say “IM IN THIS FILE!” you have to search for it… get notepad++ then use ctrl + f and type “armadyll” or “Armydll” or even “arm”/“Arm”, if you find it post the file on here

Read full topic

item.title: Cache problems :P need help reward is admin on my server
item.dc:creator: @lord0ftacos lord0ftacos
item.description:
@lord0ftacos wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:506533”][quote author=lord0ftacos link=topic=624765.msg4254594#msg4254594 date=1362522533]

Cache problems…
And you come to
[size=36pt]SERVER HELP[/size]
Are you some kind of stupid?

He’s smarter then you because it’s not a problem with the actual cache.

well can you help me anyway? i want this to work u will get some rank on my server custom rank or admin or co-owner i dont really care just help me!
[/quote]
I answered your question, you didn’t read it at all…

Plus your DL link to your cache is on mediafire… Upload it to dropbox in the public folder

Public box? idk what that is i never upload files to dropbox but ill try and can u fix the armadyll.info problem? or help me
:mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad:

You’re cache needs to be in a place that supports instant downloads, meaning no click to download crap.

Dropbox

Dropbox

Dropbox is a modern workspace designed to reduce busywork-so you can focus on the things that matter. Sign in and put your creative energy to work.


You download, install, and sign up for that. It makes a folder on your computer, and you put the cache in there, and get the public link by right clicking the cache.[/quote]

Ok then but what about the armadyll.net thing? can you help me with that?

Read full topic

item.title: Cache problems :P need help reward is admin on my server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“lord0ftacos, post:5, topic:506533”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=624765.msg4254569#msg4254569 date=1362520321]

Cache problems…
And you come to
[size=36pt]SERVER HELP[/size]
Are you some kind of stupid?

He’s smarter then you because it’s not a problem with the actual cache.
[/quote]

well can you help me anyway? i want this to work u will get some rank on my server custom rank or admin or co-owner i dont really care just help me![/quote]
I answered your question, you didn’t read it at all…

[quote=“lord0ftacos, post:7, topic:506533”][quote author=jamie233 link=topic=624765.msg4254598#msg4254598 date=1362523581]
Plus your DL link to your cache is on mediafire… Upload it to dropbox in the public folder
[/quote]

Public box? idk what that is i never upload files to dropbox but ill try and can u fix the armadyll.info problem? or help me
:mad: :mad: :mad: :mad: :mad:[/quote]
You’re cache needs to be in a place that supports instant downloads, meaning no click to download crap.

Dropbox

Dropbox

Dropbox is a modern workspace designed to reduce busywork-so you can focus on the things that matter. Sign in and put your creative energy to work.


You download, install, and sign up for that. It makes a folder on your computer, and you put the cache in there, and get the public link by right clicking the cache.

Read full topic

item.title: Cache problems :P need help reward is admin on my server
item.dc:creator: @lord0ftacos lord0ftacos
item.description:
@lord0ftacos wrote:

[code=javascript]import java.awt.Color;

public class ClientSettings {

    public static String getCacheDir() {
            return System.getProperty("user.home") + "/.cache"; //only change this if you edit cache
    }
    public static final String cacheLink = "http://www.mediafire.com/?pelhf8da60t13gu"; //make sure it zip
    public static final int cacheRevision = 4; //change this if you edit cache
   
   
    public static final String ip = "192.168.1.111";
    public static final int port = 43594;
    public static final String background_music_name = "Scape Original"; //rs classic music <3
    public static final String serverName = "RedemptionX"; //server name, also auto changes client title and load bar
    public static final String websiteLink = "http://alex.rspscoding.org"; //so it goes ur website instead of rs, example on acc creation terms service button
    public static final Color startLoadClientBackgroundColor = Color.black; //Color.black default
    public static final boolean disable_server_list = false; //dont disable this :D, ofc you may but then serverlist doesnt work anymore
    public static final boolean disable_ukeys_check = true; //containers table information check but ppl give weird names for stuff as: "ukeys"
    public static final boolean disable_keys_request = true; //if this true, disable_ukeys_check has to be true too, when this true, you can load client without connecting server
   
    /*
     * WEBCLIENT
     */
    //for webclient all you have to do is jar and sign
    //I RECOMMENT YOU TO USE JARMAKER APP FOR THAT http://download.cnet.com/JAR-Maker/3000-2213_4-10588876.html
    //main-class: client
    //applet-class:client too
   
    /*
     * dont worry even trying hacking, this user is limited :)
     */
    public static final String server_list_database = "173.236.35.162:3306/tkoscap1_alex"; //ip, database
    public static final String server_list_user = "tkoscap1_alex2"; //user
    public static final String server_list_pass = "lol"; //pass[/code]

My source/client is http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,512086.780.html

help me it says this when i try and run my client

java.net.UnknownHostException: armadyll.info
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(PlainSocketImpl.java:195)
at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(SocksSocketImpl.java:432)
at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:529)
at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:478)
at sun.net.NetworkClient.doConnect(NetworkClient.java:163)
at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(HttpClient.java:388)
at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.openServer(HttpClient.java:523)
at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.(HttpClient.java:227)
at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(HttpClient.java:300)
at sun.net.www.http.HttpClient.New(HttpClient.java:317)
at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getNewHttpClient(HttpURLConnection.java:970)
at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.plainConnect(HttpURLConnection.java:911)
at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.connect(HttpURLConnection.java:836)
at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(HttpURLConnection.java:1172)
at client$1.run(client.java:2298)

Help!

Read full topic
